title: Braised Eggplant Parmesan

Produce: 3 medium Japanese eggplants (about 1 1/2 lbs. total), trimmed and sliced lengthwise into 1/2-in.-thick planks
1/2 cup torn fresh basil leaves, plus more for garnish
Dairy: 4 oz. fresh mozzarella, torn into 1/2-in. pieces
1/2 cup (2 oz.) grated Parmesan cheese, divided

steps: Position a rack 6 inches from heat source; preheat broiler to high. Arrange eggplant in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet; brush both sides with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Broil until tender and lightly charred, 4 to 6 minutes per side. Set aside.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high. Add garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add tomatoes with their juices, oregano, and salt. Bring to a simmer, crushing tomatoes with a spoon. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in basil and half of the mozzarella.
Arrange eggplant in sauce in a slightly overlapping pattern. Sprinkle with panko and remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses.
Bake at 425Â°F until sauce is bubbly and cheese is melted and browned, about 10 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes. Garnish with basil.
